headline: Micron Is Suddenly at the Center of AI Spending As Shares Keep Soaring

headline: Meta, Amazon, and Goolge Lead a $700 Billion Capex Wave: What Stocks Win Beyond NVIDIA?
summary: The AI infrastructure arms race has reached a staggering scale. Hyperscalers are collectively pouring approximately $700 billion into AI CapEx in 2026. Amazon (Nasdaq: AMZN) just announced $200 billion in planned spend, Alphabet (Nasdaq: GOOGL) is projected $185, Meta Platforms (Nasdaq: META) up to $135 billion, and Microsoft will reveal an updated capex target closer to summer. ... Meta, Amazon, and Goolge Lead a $700 Billion Capex Wave: What Stocks Win Beyond NVIDIA?

headline: Micron Stock Surges, Morgan Stanley Says There's More Room To Run
summary: Micron Technology Inc (NASDAQ:MU) stock is trading higher Wednesday after Morgan Stanley reiterated its Overweight rating and boosted its price target from $350 to $450. Here’s what you should know. Why Micron Is Moving Higher Analyst Joseph Moore pointed to continued DRAM price strength and persistent supply shortages as the main reasons behind the improved outlook, Investing.com reported. headline: AI Chips Today - Arteris Achieves Major Milestone With Network-On-Chip Technology
summary: Arteris, Inc., a prominent semiconductor technology provider, has reached a significant milestone with its network-on-chip technology now deployed in over 4 billion chips and chiplets. This expansion reflects the growing adoption of Arteris' technology across a variety of sectors including AI-driven automotive, enterprise computing, and consumer electronics. The company's interconnect IP is increasingly crucial for modern AI-era chip designs, which demand high performance, energy efficiency,...

headline: AI: The Great Disruptor or the Great Divider?
summary: Wall Street faced a bruising session as the S&P 500 wiped out its gains for the year. While artificial intelligence remains the primary engine of growth for some, it has become a source of margin pressure and competitive fear for others, leading to a sharp rotation toward value stocks.

headline: Nvidia Deepens AI Inference Push With Groq Deal And Rubin Platform
summary: Nvidia agreed to acquire Groq's AI inference chip assets for $20b, aiming to expand its position in AI deployment hardware. The company introduced its new Rubin chip platform, designed around next generation memory technology for inference workloads. Samsung and Micron are set to supply HBM4 memory for Nvidia's new GPU platforms, signaling changes in its component supply chain. Recent U.S. policy signals on legacy AI chip exports to China may affect how Nvidia serves that market. NVIDIA...

headline: AI Angst in US Stocks Sends Global Money Chasing Asia’s Winners
summary: The MSCI Asia Pacific Index has risen more than 12% in 2026, in contrast to losses in US benchmarks as shares were sold off on fears that AI models may threaten the business of software, legal and real estate service providers.  The divergence underscores global funds’ shift of preference from AI pioneers burdened by massive spending toward hardware producers with strong pricing power, many of whom are in Asia.  Surging memory chip prices have been a boon for the region’s heavyweights such as Samsung Electronics Co., while Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co.’s irreplaceable role as the world’s leading contract chipmaker has provided support for Taiwanese stocks.
